sysevent_email_action.message_html:
Greetings, ${first_name},

Pursuing a doctorate is a worthy goal – one that can open up a world of opportunities for you.

With an Ed.D., you are prepared to become a superintendent in a school district, a university professor, a corporate executive or policymaker.  A Doctorate of Education (Ed.D.) is a terminal degree, as is a Ph.D. earned by Doctors of Philosophy. The difference is that Ph.D.s focus on developing new research, whereas Ed.D.s are educational leaders who apply research to their organizational, leadership and educational issues.

See 6 reasons students choose Sac State for their doctorate

The Sacramento State Ed.D. program was authorized to address the need for well-prepared administrators to lead California’s public schools and community colleges. It is a unique program that links theory, research and practice that is directly relevant to regional needs.

Career advancement

One very valid reason to pursue a doctorate is to open up career opportunities.  A faculty position at a university, school superintendency, research position and other education policy leadership positions may be out of reach without a doctorate.

Just 1.8 percent of the U.S. population has a doctorate, according to a 2014 estimate by the U.S. Census Bureau. That rarity puts you in a desirable and very employable category. In fact, California school administrators earned, on average, more than $100,000 a year during 2014.

 

What a doctorate does for your employability

The amount of reading, summarizing and writing you’ll do during your doctoral studies cannot help but make you a better project manager, supervisor or multitasker.

Your experience as a researcher – collecting, analyzing and interpreting data – will be invaluable to an employer in a world driven by ROI and data-driven decision-making.

For the first seven cohorts of the Sacramento State Ed.D. program, an average of 28 percent received a promotion while still in the program, and 79 percent expected to receive a promotion after graduation. See the 6 best reasons to choose Sacramento State for your doctorate.

Are you cut out to be an Ed.D.?

To find out if you have what it takes to be a Doctor of Education – a transformational leader who can make change happen in your organization – join us at one of our monthly information sessions. See the schedule and RSVP at bit.ly/SacStateDoc.

Please call our office at 916-278-2282 if you have any questions, or email us at EDD@csus.edu. We look forward to getting to know you better.
